column4: quick question. wpa_supplicant wants a driver, the default is wext. Is there an easy way to check which kind I have?
lspci | grep -i wireless
I tried, but it doesn't seem to be working. I'm in the odd position of having Network Manager work, but wpa_supplicant doesn't seem to be.
You stopped networkmanager for real?
It's running atm, or I wouldn't be on IRC. wpa_supplicant doesn't work even when I don't have Network Manager running, though (trying to get wireless up and running without having to start gdm/X up)
You can have NM without X, too.
That may be a heck of a lot easier. What's the cli command?
None. Just start X and open the network settings.
That's what I'm trying to avoid. I want to be able to do everything without X to conserve battery life, and Network Manager is the only thing getting in the way.
any other thoughts on wpa_supplicant not working? It's a broadcom on an hp netbook, if that helps.
ifconfig -a says what?
eth1 is my wireless, which bit of info do you want
can you do iwlist eth1 scan?
Yes
I would zero out the first few MBs.
